arp-reply.help: Enable to respond to ARP requests for this virtual IP address. Enabled by default.
arp-reply.name: arp-reply

color.help: Color of icon on the GUI.
color.name: color

dns-mapping-ttl.help: DNS mapping TTL (Set to zero to use TTL in DNS response, default = 0).
dns-mapping-ttl.name: dns-mapping-ttl

extintf.help: Interface connected to the source network that receives the packets that will be forwarded to the destination network.
extintf.name: extintf

extip.help: IP address or address range on the external interface that you want to map to an address or address range on the destination network.
extip.name: extip

extport.help: Incoming port number range that you want to map to a port number range on the destination network.
extport.name: extport

gratuitous-arp-interval.help: Enable to have the VIP send gratuitous ARPs. 0=disabled. Set from 5 up to 8640000 seconds to enable.
gratuitous-arp-interval.name: gratuitous-arp-interval

http-cookie-age.help: Time in minutes that client web browsers should keep a cookie. Default is 60 minutes. 0 = no time limit.
http-cookie-age.name: http-cookie-age

http-cookie-domain.help: Domain that HTTP cookie persistence should apply to.
http-cookie-domain.name: http-cookie-domain

http-cookie-domain-from-host.help: Enable/disable use of HTTP cookie domain from host field in HTTP.
http-cookie-domain-from-host.name: http-cookie-domain-from-host

options.help: Disable use of HTTP cookie domain from host field in HTTP (use http-cooke-domain setting).
options.name: disable

options.help: Enable use of HTTP cookie domain from host field in HTTP.
options.name: enable

http-cookie-generation.help: Generation of HTTP cookie to be accepted. Changing invalidates all existing cookies.
http-cookie-generation.name: http-cookie-generation

http-cookie-path.help: Limit HTTP cookie persistence to the specified path.
http-cookie-path.name: http-cookie-path

http-cookie-share.help: Control sharing of cookies across virtual servers. Use of same-ip means a cookie from one virtual server can be used by another. Disable stops cookie sharing.
http-cookie-share.name: http-cookie-share

options.help: Only allow HTTP cookie to match this virtual server.
options.name: disable

options.help: Allow HTTP cookie to match any virtual server with same IP.
options.name: same-ip

http-ip-header.help: For HTTP multiplexing, enable to add the original client IP address in the XForwarded-For HTTP header.
http-ip-header.name: http-ip-header

http-ip-header-name.help: For HTTP multiplexing, enter a custom HTTPS header name. The original client IP address is added to this header. If empty, X-Forwarded-For is used.
http-ip-header-name.name: http-ip-header-name

http-redirect.help: Enable/disable redirection of HTTP to HTTPS.
http-redirect.name: http-redirect

options.help: Enable redirection of HTTP to HTTPS.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable redirection of HTTP to HTTPS.
options.name: disable

https-cookie-secure.help: Enable/disable verification that inserted HTTPS cookies are secure.
https-cookie-secure.name: https-cookie-secure

options.help: Do not mark cookie as secure, allow sharing between an HTTP and HTTPS connection.
options.name: disable

options.help: Mark inserted cookie as secure, cookie can only be used for HTTPS a connection.
options.name: enable

ipv6-mappedip.help: Range of mapped IPv6 addresses. Specify the start IPv6 address followed by a space and the end IPv6 address.
ipv6-mappedip.name: ipv6-mappedip

ipv6-mappedport.help: IPv6 port number range on the destination network to which the external port number range is mapped.
ipv6-mappedport.name: ipv6-mappedport

ldb-method.help: Method used to distribute sessions to real servers.
ldb-method.name: ldb-method

options.help: Distribute to server based on source IP.
options.name: static

options.help: Distribute to server based round robin order.
options.name: round-robin

options.help: Distribute to server based on weight.
options.name: weighted

options.help: Distribute to server with lowest session count.
options.name: least-session

options.help: Distribute to server with lowest Round-Trip-Time.
options.name: least-rtt

options.help: Distribute to the first server that is alive.
options.name: first-alive

options.help: Distribute to server based on host field in HTTP header.
options.name: http-host

mappedip.help: IP address or address range on the destination network to which the external IP address is mapped.
mappedip.name: mappedip

mappedport.help: Port number range on the destination network to which the external port number range is mapped.
mappedport.name: mappedport

monitor.help: Name of the health check monitor to use when polling to determine a virtual server's connectivity status.
monitor.name: monitor

nat-source-vip.help: Enable/disable forcing the source NAT mapped IP to the external IP for all traffic.
nat-source-vip.name: nat-source-vip

options.help: Force only the source NAT mapped IP to the external IP for traffic egressing the external interface of the VIP.
options.name: disable

options.help: Force the source NAT mapped IP to the external IP for all traffic.
options.name: enable

outlook-web-access.help: Enable to add the Front-End-Https header for Microsoft Outlook Web Access.
outlook-web-access.name: outlook-web-access

persistence.help: Configure how to make sure that clients connect to the same server every time they make a request that is part of the same session.
persistence.name: persistence

protocol.help: Protocol to use when forwarding packets.
protocol.name: protocol

address.help: Dynamic address of the real server.
address.name: address

client-ip.help: Only clients in this IP range can connect to this real server.
client-ip.name: client-ip

healthcheck.help: Enable to check the responsiveness of the real server before forwarding traffic.
healthcheck.name: healthcheck

options.help: Use health check defined in VIP.
options.name: vip

holddown-interval.help: Time in seconds that the health check monitor continues to monitor and unresponsive server that should be active.
holddown-interval.name: holddown-interval

http-host.help: HTTP server domain name in HTTP header.
http-host.name: http-host

ip.help: IP address of the real server.
ip.name: ip

max-connections.help: Max number of active connections that can be directed to the real server. When reached, sessions are sent to other real servers.
max-connections.name: max-connections

monitor.help: Name of the health check monitor to use when polling to determine a virtual server's connectivity status.
monitor.name: monitor

port.help: Port for communicating with the real server. Required if port forwarding is enabled.
port.name: port

status.help: Set the status of the real server to active so that it can accept traffic, or on standby or disabled so no traffic is sent.
status.name: status

weight.help: Weight of the real server. If weighted load balancing is enabled, the server with the highest weight gets more connections.
weight.name: weight

realservers.help: Select the real servers that this server load balancing VIP will distribute traffic to.
realservers.name: realservers

server-type.help: Protocol to be load balanced by the virtual server (also called the server load balance virtual IP).
server-type.name: server-type

src-filter.help: Source address filter. Each address must be either an IP/subnet (x.x.x.x/n) or a range (x.x.x.x-y.y.y.y). Separate addresses with spaces.
src-filter.name: src-filter

srcintf-filter.help: Interfaces to which the VIP applies. Separate the names with spaces.
srcintf-filter.name: srcintf-filter

ssl-accept-ffdhe-groups.help: Enable/disable FFDHE cipher suite for SSL key exchange.
ssl-accept-ffdhe-groups.name: ssl-accept-ffdhe-groups

ssl-algorithm.help: Permitted encryption algorithms for SSL sessions according to encryption strength.
ssl-algorithm.name: ssl-algorithm

options.help: High encryption. Allow only AES and ChaCha.
options.name: high

options.help: Medium encryption. Allow AES, ChaCha, 3DES, and RC4.
options.name: medium

options.help: Low encryption. Allow AES, ChaCha, 3DES, RC4, and DES.
options.name: low

options.help: Custom encryption. Use config ssl-cipher-suites to select the cipher suites that are allowed.
options.name: custom

ssl-certificate.help: The name of the certificate to use for SSL handshake.
ssl-certificate.name: ssl-certificate

versions.help: SSL/TLS versions that the cipher suite can be used with.
versions.name: versions

ssl-cipher-suites.help: SSL/TLS cipher suites acceptable from a client, ordered by priority.
ssl-cipher-suites.name: ssl-cipher-suites

ssl-client-fallback.help: Enable/disable support for preventing Downgrade Attacks on client connections (RFC 7507).
ssl-client-fallback.name: ssl-client-fallback

ssl-client-rekey-count.help: Maximum length of data in MB before triggering a client rekey (0 = disable).
ssl-client-rekey-count.name: ssl-client-rekey-count

ssl-client-renegotiation.help: Allow, deny, or require secure renegotiation of client sessions to comply with RFC 5746.
ssl-client-renegotiation.name: ssl-client-renegotiation

options.help: Allow a SSL client to renegotiate.
options.name: allow

options.help: Abort any client initiated SSL re-negotiation attempt.
options.name: deny

options.help: Abort any client initiated SSL re-negotiation attempt that does not use RFC 5746 Secure Renegotiation.
options.name: secure

ssl-client-session-state-max.help: Maximum number of client to FortiGate SSL session states to keep.
ssl-client-session-state-max.name: ssl-client-session-state-max

ssl-client-session-state-timeout.help: Number of minutes to keep client to FortiGate SSL session state.
ssl-client-session-state-timeout.name: ssl-client-session-state-timeout

ssl-client-session-state-type.help: How to expire SSL sessions for the segment of the SSL connection between the client and the FortiGate.
ssl-client-session-state-type.name: ssl-client-session-state-type

options.help: Expire session states after this many minutes.
options.name: time

options.help: Expire session states when this maximum is reached.
options.name: count

options.help: Expire session states based on time or count, whichever occurs first.
options.name: both

ssl-dh-bits.help: Number of bits to use in the Diffie-Hellman exchange for RSA encryption of SSL sessions.
ssl-dh-bits.name: ssl-dh-bits

ssl-hpkp.help: Enable/disable including HPKP header in response.
ssl-hpkp.name: ssl-hpkp

options.help: Do not add a HPKP header to each HTTP response.
options.name: disable

options.help: Add a HPKP header to each a HTTP response.
options.name: enable

options.help: Add a HPKP Report-Only header to each HTTP response.
options.name: report-only

ssl-hpkp-age.help: Number of seconds the client should honor the HPKP setting.
ssl-hpkp-age.name: ssl-hpkp-age

ssl-hpkp-backup.help: Certificate to generate backup HPKP pin from.
ssl-hpkp-backup.name: ssl-hpkp-backup

ssl-hpkp-include-subdomains.help: Indicate that HPKP header applies to all subdomains.
ssl-hpkp-include-subdomains.name: ssl-hpkp-include-subdomains

options.help: HPKP header does not apply to subdomains.
options.name: disable

ssl-hpkp-primary.help: Certificate to generate primary HPKP pin from.
ssl-hpkp-primary.name: ssl-hpkp-primary

ssl-hpkp-report-uri.help: URL to report HPKP violations to.
ssl-hpkp-report-uri.name: ssl-hpkp-report-uri

ssl-hsts.help: Enable/disable including HSTS header in response.
ssl-hsts.name: ssl-hsts

options.help: Do not add a HSTS header to each a HTTP response.
options.name: disable

options.help: Add a HSTS header to each HTTP response.
options.name: enable

ssl-hsts-age.help: Number of seconds the client should honor the HSTS setting.
ssl-hsts-age.name: ssl-hsts-age

ssl-hsts-include-subdomains.help: Indicate that HSTS header applies to all subdomains.
ssl-hsts-include-subdomains.name: ssl-hsts-include-subdomains

options.help: HSTS header does not apply to subdomains.
options.name: disable

ssl-http-location-conversion.help: Enable to replace HTTP with HTTPS in the reply's Location HTTP header field.
ssl-http-location-conversion.name: ssl-http-location-conversion

ssl-http-match-host.help: Enable/disable HTTP host matching for location conversion.
ssl-http-match-host.name: ssl-http-match-host

options.help: Match HTTP host in response header.
options.name: enable

ssl-max-version.help: Highest SSL/TLS version acceptable from a client.
ssl-max-version.name: ssl-max-version

ssl-min-version.help: Lowest SSL/TLS version acceptable from a client.
ssl-min-version.name: ssl-min-version

ssl-mode.help: Apply SSL offloading between the client and the FortiGate (half) or from the client to the FortiGate and from the FortiGate to the server (full).
ssl-mode.name: ssl-mode

options.help: Client to FortiGate and FortiGate to Server SSL.
options.name: full

ssl-pfs.help: Select the cipher suites that can be used for SSL perfect forward secrecy (PFS). Applies to both client and server sessions.
ssl-pfs.name: ssl-pfs

options.help: Allow only Diffie-Hellman cipher-suites, so PFS is applied.
options.name: require

options.help: Allow only non-Diffie-Hellman cipher-suites, so PFS is not applied.
options.name: deny

options.help: Allow use of any cipher suite so PFS may or may not be used depending on the cipher suite selected.
options.name: allow

ssl-send-empty-frags.help: Enable/disable sending empty fragments to avoid CBC IV attacks (SSL 3.0 & TLS 1.0 only). May need to be disabled for compatibility with older systems.
ssl-send-empty-frags.name: ssl-send-empty-frags

ssl-server-algorithm.help: Permitted encryption algorithms for the server side of SSL full mode sessions according to encryption strength.
ssl-server-algorithm.name: ssl-server-algorithm

options.help: High encryption. Allow only AES and ChaCha.
options.name: high

options.help: Medium encryption. Allow AES, ChaCha, 3DES, and RC4.
options.name: medium

options.help: Low encryption. Allow AES, ChaCha, 3DES, RC4, and DES.
options.name: low

options.help: Custom encryption. Use ssl-server-cipher-suites to select the cipher suites that are allowed.
options.name: custom

options.help: Use the same encryption algorithms for both client and server sessions.
options.name: client

versions.help: SSL/TLS versions that the cipher suite can be used with.
versions.name: versions

ssl-server-cipher-suites.help: SSL/TLS cipher suites to offer to a server, ordered by priority.
ssl-server-cipher-suites.name: ssl-server-cipher-suites

ssl-server-max-version.help: Highest SSL/TLS version acceptable from a server. Use the client setting by default.
ssl-server-max-version.name: ssl-server-max-version

options.help: Use same value as client configuration.
options.name: client

ssl-server-min-version.help: Lowest SSL/TLS version acceptable from a server. Use the client setting by default.
ssl-server-min-version.name: ssl-server-min-version

options.help: Use same value as client configuration.
options.name: client

ssl-server-session-state-max.help: Maximum number of FortiGate to Server SSL session states to keep.
ssl-server-session-state-max.name: ssl-server-session-state-max

ssl-server-session-state-timeout.help: Number of minutes to keep FortiGate to Server SSL session state.
ssl-server-session-state-timeout.name: ssl-server-session-state-timeout

ssl-server-session-state-type.help: How to expire SSL sessions for the segment of the SSL connection between the server and the FortiGate.
ssl-server-session-state-type.name: ssl-server-session-state-type

options.help: Expire session states after this many minutes.
options.name: time

options.help: Expire session states when this maximum is reached.
options.name: count

options.help: Expire session states based on time or count, whichever occurs first.
options.name: both

type.help: Configure a static NAT, load balance, server load balance, access proxy, DNS translation, or FQDN VIP.
type.name: type

uuid.help: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID; automatically assigned but can be manually reset).
uuid.name: uuid

weblogic-server.help: Enable to add an HTTP header to indicate SSL offloading for a WebLogic server.
weblogic-server.name: weblogic-server

options.help: Do not add HTTP header indicating SSL offload for WebLogic server.
options.name: disable

options.help: Add HTTP header indicating SSL offload for WebLogic server.
options.name: enable

websphere-server.help: Enable to add an HTTP header to indicate SSL offloading for a WebSphere server.
websphere-server.name: websphere-server

options.help: Do not add HTTP header indicating SSL offload for WebSphere server.
options.name: disable

options.help: Add HTTP header indicating SSL offload for WebSphere server.
options.name: enable
